title: THETA (x50-100) potential, most likely one of the best token out there (don't trust me, read and you will see for yourself)
body:
Hello guys I'm surprised I haven't seen this token yet in this list, because going through the whole whitepaper and annoying technical details is super annoying, let me just try to ELI5 this and list the key points so you can have a better understanding of what this project really is. But first some key points:

- website: https://www.thetatoken.org/

- Some companies involved in Theta you may have heard of: Samsung (Investor and validator node), Sony (Investor and validator node), Google (validator node)...

- https://theta.tv/ is **NOT** a platform meant to compete with Youtube as many people think (quite the opposite I'd say), but rather a live version of their ecosystem and a proof that it's working perfectly (to pitch future partners, convince skeptical investors or simply individuals like you and me)

- Some partnerships: **World Poker Tour** (WPT), GFUEL

- Notable advisors: Steve Chen **Co-founder of Youtube**, [Justin Kan](https://www.youtube.com/c/JustinKanTV)** Co-founder of Twitch**, Kyle Okamoto CNO at **Verizon**, Jonathan Wong Director of product at **Rakuten**

- Also have a powerful NFT platform https://www.thetadrop.com/ with big partnerships ongoing (WPT, GFUEL) and incoming (Katy Perry...)

- Several [patents awarded](https://medium.com/theta-network)

Now let's get to the good stuff:

**ELI5**: Theta is (among other things) a decentralized CDN (stands for "content delivery network", you know, the thing that delivers a video or a stream when you watch some content on youtube for instance). Theta allows people to share their extra bandwidth when they are not using it (and be rewarded for it). 

[Here is a 1mn animated video easy to understand](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OQR7GVoV-24)

Basically, Theta is a decentralized video delivery network, instead of relying on big centralized expensive servers, they will offer content delivery platforms (such as Youtube, Netflix, Twitch, Amazon Prime... you name it) the opportunity to reduce significantly their cost, **we are talking about 50%** [like it was the case for Cinedigm](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cinedigm-integrates-theta-network-launch-132500928.html), (a Netflix like platform for anime if you're not familiar with it). Instead of having big centralized servers, the network will be split among users in a decentralized way and through blockchain.

Here is the quote from their [whitepaper](https://docs.thetatoken.org/docs/what-is-theta-network) 

> Theta Network is the leading video delivery network powered by blockchain technology. Theta allows users to simultaneously watch video content and earn token rewards for relaying video to other users who are also watching the same content. In the same vein as other sharing economy models, users opt-in to volunteering their spare bandwidth and computing resources to relay video to other users and earn token rewards for their contributions. Users can contribute to Theta Network on any PC, mobile device, or smart TV.

Right now Theta is not ready yet to be implemented on big platforms such as Youtube, but imagine when it will be the case? ​Do you think it's a big bold claim that has no chance to happen? Then read the following:


# The token itself

Theta has 3 tokens

[$THETA](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/theta/) 1B tokens / $6.4 each / 6.4B marketcap 

[$TFUEL](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/tfuel/) 5.3B tokens / $0.29 each / 1.5B marketcap

$TDROP (inc Feb 2022, airdrop will be made to $THETA holders)

Theta is Proof of Stake, both Theta and Tfuel are stakable which will provide a double passive income if we get involved in it.
Staking rewards (for both theta and tfuel) are made in $tfuel. If you're worrying about the tfuel inflation, just read pages 4 & 5 of [this](https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/assets.thetatoken.org/Theta-white-paper-3-0-latest.pdf), they explain the mint/burn mechanism in a fairly simple way.

The total market cap is approximately 8 billons, this is nothing considering the current size of the project and its potential of solving big tech giants' problems. As a comparison, Cardano has 50b marketcap (10x theta).

# What's in it for us

**I suggest investing 50/50 of the sum you choose to invest into respectively $theta and $tfuel**, this will allow us to:

- Benefit from both staking rewards, passive income along the way
- Benefit from the rising price

# Coming in the near future

- December 2021: Katy Perry (140 M followers on Instagram) to launch NFT on Theta ([more info](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/06/30/katy-perry-launches-nfts-acquires-stake-in-theta-labs/))

- February 2022: TDROP a new coin to be added in the ecosystem [more info](https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/assets.thetatoken.org/Theta-Ecosystem-2022-and-TDROP-Whitepaper.pdf?v=1630330816.909))


# Some articles

- https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2020/05/27/google-signs-on-as-network-validator-for-blockchain-video-network-theta/

- https://cointelegraph.com/news/cinedigm-integrates-theta-blockchain-tech-into-anime-streaming-channel

- https://www.forbes.com/sites/billybambrough/2020/05/26/this-crypto-could-blow-bitcoin-out-of-the-water-this-year-after-1000-gain-heres-why/


## Rumor

Theta and Verizon partnership (of course the fact that Kyle Okamoto is their advisor, fuels this rumor)
https://twitter.com/jam_coin/status/1381263095654281217?s=21
https://www.reddit.com/r/theta_network/comments/n1yt18/its_long_been_rumored_that_theta_and_verizon_have/
